# Truss Submission (TRUSS)

A truss submission is required when the approved architectural plans for a **residential** structure identify pre-manufactured trusses for the floor framing or the roof of the structure.  


## ON THIS PAGE

  * Who Should Apply?
  * Plan Ahead
  * How Do I Submit My Record?



  * What's Next?
  * Additional Resources



_This information is the most common for how to obtain the necessary approval for your project and is not representative of all the conditions you may encounter._

## WHO SHOULD APPLY?

Contacts listed on the original permit record in PLUS may submit a truss record in PLUS.

## PLAN AHEAD

During the building review of the submitted architectural plans for your residential project, staff will determine whether a truss submission is required. When required, an applicant will be notified of the truss submission requirement via email, once the associated building permit is issued. Truss submission is required _**prior**_ to scheduling the framing inspection.

## HOW DO I SUBMIT MY RECORD?

### **PLUS Application**

Apply for your truss submission by first locating the appropriate permit record and selecting the **Make Changes (_Figure 1)_** action.

_**Figure 1**_

  
Select **Truss Submission (_Figure 2)_** as the appropriate amendment type. Then click **Continue Application.**

_**Figure 2**_

  
In the **Project Description** field, type “Truss Submission” then click **Continue Application (_Figure 3_)**.

_**Figure 3**_

  
If you receive the below error message while attempting to submit **(_Figure 4_)**, please contact the Residential Fast Track building review team by emailing LDSResTruss@fairfaxcounty.gov or by calling 703 631-5101, TTY 711.

**_Figure 4_**

  
Under **Step 3: Receipt/Record Submittal** , in the digital plan room, you will receive confirmation of your submission with a unique record number for the truss record. Select **Upload Plans and Documents** **(_Figure 5_) **to submit the truss review package.

**_Figure 5_**

In the plan room **(_Figure 6_)**, upload the following required documents:

  * Truss Coversheet
  * Truss Layout plan - PDF
  * Truss Package – profile sheets for all truss types, submitted via a single PDF with a valid digital signature for the Virginia-licensed designer.



**_Figure 6_**

### **Instructional Video for Submitting**

## What's Next?

### Review Process

Staff will review the submission for accuracy and compliance with zoning ordinance and approved plans. You will be asked to correct any deficiencies. Standard revision fees apply.

### Issuance

Once reviews are approved and fees have been paid, your stamped truss layout and truss coversheet will be available to download from PLUS.

Helpful Video:

Access Approved Plans in PLUS - YouTube Video

### Inspections

The county must be notified once stages of construction are reached that require an inspection. **Once your truss submission is approved and available for download, you may proceed with scheduling your framing inspection.** For more information, see our inspections webpage.

Helpful Video:

Building Inspections (an overview on how to schedule an inspection) - YouTube Video

Scheduling Building Inspections (a deeper dive into scheduling inspections, including common issues) - YouTube Video
